summary: This document outlines the unanimous consent of the Board of Trustees of The J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc. regarding the resignation of three trustees and the appointment of new officers. It details the appointments of Jeffrey E. Epstein as President, Darren K. Indyke as Vice President, and Erika Kellerhals as Treasurer and Secretary, while also removing previous officers from their positions.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Appointed as President of The J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Appointed as Vice President of The J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc.

persons.name: Erika Kellerhals
persons.context: Appointed as both Treasurer and Secretary of The J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc.

persons.name: Cecile de Jongh
persons.context: Tendered resignation from the Board of Trustees of The J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc.

persons.name: Jeanne Brennan
persons.context: Tendered resignation from the Board of Trustees of The J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein appointed Darren K. Indyke as Vice President of the Foundation.
Jeffrey E. Epstein appointed Erika Kellerhals as Treasurer and Secretary of the Foundation.
Both Darren K. Indyke and Erika Kellerhals were appointed as officers of the Foundation.

events.title: Resignation of Trustees
events.description: Darren K. Indyke, Cecile de Jongh, and Jeanne Brennan tendered their resignations from the Board of Trustees.

events.title: Appointment of New Officers
events.description: New officers were appointed to The J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc. following the resignations.

keyFacts: The document is a unanimous consent resolution from the Board of Trustees of The J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc.
Darren K. Indyke, Cecile de Jongh, and Jeanne Brennan resigned from their positions on February 29, 2012.
Jeffrey E. Epstein was appointed as President, Darren K. Indyke as Vice President, and Erika Kellerhals as Treasurer and Secretary on March 1, 2012.
All previous officers not appointed in the new resolution were removed from their positions.
